meanings.definition: To destroy completely; put an end to.
meanings.sent1: Using strong medicine eradicates the illness.
meanings.sent2: The pesticide eradicates the pests in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's power to eradicate villains made him popular at parties.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could eradicate any trace of sadness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter's quick action eradicated the flames before they spread.

meanings.sent1: The floodwaters can eradicate entire crops in minutes.
meanings.sent2: The vaccine has the power to eradicate diseases.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand seemed to eradicate the rabbit from the hat.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed could eradicate any obstacle in his path.
meanings.sent5: The powerful storm could eradicate everything in its path.

meanings.sent1: The new software can eradicate all viruses from your computer.
meanings.sent2: The army's mission was to eradicate the enemy's stronghold.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient could eradicate any bland taste from the dish.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brushstrokes seemed to eradicate all imperfections from the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The detective's keen eye could eradicate any doubt about the suspect's guilt.
